Reviews.Title: “A very enjoyable stay.”
Reviews.Author: ChipnNikki
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over Easter weekend and had a brilliant experience. The hotel was very clean and pleasant, and the staff were always helpful especially Elburto on reception who was there on our arrival and helped us out with a map and good directions to town. We found the Hotels location to be ideal for us and we walked most of the time into Central Rome and used the Hotel shuttle service a couple of times, the driver was a very pleasant man. Breakfast was enjoyable however the coffee from the machine was not too good so we asked for one at the bar and they were happy to oblige. The pool was not available for use due to being out of season and we had to pay extra for the sauna. The roof terrace was a lovely space to take a bottle of wine and olives (not from the bar only peanuts available) and was underused by the rest of the residents. Overall a good hotel choice for a brilliant experience in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Not a four star - but at that price, who is complaining ?”
Reviews.Author: fgyara
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a holiday with the family. Got a very good deal on the hotel through Expedia. And at that price, I cannot complaint. Its not the best location in town - but it has decent transport links. The metro is literally around the corner. The bus stop for the 990 is 2 minutes away. The bus runs every 10-15 minutes right up to midnight and starts and ends at Piazza Cavour (a fifteen minute ride) which is a convenient 5-15 minute walk from most of the tourist traps. Tickets cost 1 euro each way (or four euros for the day) and must be bought before boarding (from the tabacchi just under the metro station). The "free shuttle" is a bus capable of carrying 8 persons. The hotel building and rooms are well maintained and clean. The rooms are starting to look a little dated, but not yet scruffy. Surprisingly, there was no airconditioning in the rooms. When we asked about this, we were told that the weather is good enough to just open out the windows! The rooms are BIG by european standards - and fitted in two single and two kiddie beds. Breakfast is an uninspired affair with concentrated juice, powdery coffee, scrambled eggs that taste like sponge, bacon swimming in some liquid. The restaurant does get better for the other meals with quite a decent menu. (We dined there thrice. The first and last times were fine, but on Easter night the hotel was understaffed and the staff was over-worked. The meal took the better part of 45 minutes to turn up and there was a noticeable drop in its quality) There is a terrace lounge which is quite neatly done, but wasn't operating a service this time of the year. This is one of those places where nothing is perfect, and yet, not wrong enough to whine about. With a little better service, comfier rooms (with a working aircon) and a vastly improved brekky, it would deserve the fourth star that it claims.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, clean,quiet”
Reviews.Author: pablos19
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife & two children, the only negative that we have is we would have preferred pure fruit juice in the mornings, rather than concentrated with our breakfast, but otherwise we had an excellent weeks stay. We have stayed here twice in the past three years & have always found the staff to be very pleasant & very helpful. Yes the hotel is away from the centre of Rome but it is in a quiet & safe location which we preferred after the hustle & bustle of Rome each day & it is frequently served by the local bus 990 which runs every 15 mins up to twelve midnight & this only takes 10 mins to the Vatican or 15 mins to the Piazza Cavour, & the bus stop is just round the corner from the hotel. The bus tickets can be purchased from the local shop which is less than 150 yards away for 1 euro. In the evenings we regularly used the pleasant rooftop terrace to relax & unwind with a bottle of red. We had no issue booking the free shuttle minibus from the hotel every day that we stayed apart from the Sunday when none run. It is a pleasant 15 min walk from the hotel to the Vatican. We have always found the rooms to be very clean & bedding changed regularly. We had a departure flight late in the evening & again it was not a problem to leave our luggage at the hotel so that we could enjoy our final day in Rome. If you have already booked the Tiberio & have never stayed before, please dont be put off by any negative comments as this is a good hotel in a good location with excellent staff & you will love it .....keep up the good work Umberto !!

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: johnny5ski
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a few months back when we went to Rome. A quiet residential neighborhood hotel. Service was excellent. Staff was excellent. Extremely clean...extremely. Very quiet neighborhood where the hotel is located. Definitely a 4-star hotel as noted. We really enjoyed our time here. Thank you to the Grand Hotel Tiberio!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, quiet neighbourhood, good location”
Reviews.Author: hlaci
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel at the Vatikan area. Very quiet neighbourhood. About 15-20 min walk from the metro station, but only 50 m from the bus station Nr990. Nice and helpful staff. We reserved a superior room with balcony, it was comfortable, clean and spacious. Very nice view from the balcony. The beds are a litte bit hard, but I liked it. Breakfast a little bit poor for a 4star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good, just a shame about the location.”
Reviews.Author: Z1000sxBabe
Reviews.Content: Lovely entrance reception with seating and tv etc and the room we had was a very good size with huge bed and bathroom. The breakfast was a bit chaotic with food here and there and not in one place. Could have had more hot buffet options and coffee and juice from a machine just isn't 4star. Although the housekeeping was clean wekept having to phone down for simple things like toiletries and tea coffee etc. next time we go we will pick somewhere closer to the heart of Rome as, although a train station and bus stop were round thd corner, getting back late at night was an issue and it was quite a way out.

Reviews.Title: “Comically roman”
Reviews.Author: Brad A
Reviews.Content: I tried to ring reception to find out why there the wifi network wasn't working. I got an engaged tone for 1.5hrs at 9pm on a Saturday night. I haven't heard one of those for years. When I did get through I was told the wifi is broken, maybe it will be fixed tomorrow. I rang room service, no answer. The beds are enormous, bring the family! Or host a bunga bunga party in it.

Reviews.Title: “Roma travel”
Reviews.Author: Jeka526
Reviews.Content: pros:staff, especially umberto and morning shuttle driver and young female brunettes at desk, clean, free shuttle downtown or vatican, breakfast, close to market,atm, bus stop, metro stop, train stop, tobacco shop for tickets; refrigerator, hairdryer, rooftop,lobby,restaurant servers, fixed odor from sink drain asap, wifi free, female desk clerk arranged fixed price to airport at 5am for 65 euros for 4 people, weather last week in feb. was perfect, no rain, 65 high every day Cons: good mattress but very firm, restaurant food, rude checkout with African male, no free shuttle on sunday, only one shuttle pickup time at 6 pm, server disconnects at peak times and new password needed frequently, shuttle fills up quickly for free trips,

Reviews.Title: “Not my up of tea...”
Reviews.Author: greece_traveler_9
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night for the Six Nations Rugby 2012 with friends. The hotel was chosen because it had a 4 star rating and to be fair if I was only to judge the rooms then that is a good reflection of the standard. Room were clean and well equipped, staff in reception friendly and even tho it is a way out from the city centre it is fairly easy to get to and from attractions. The hotel has a shuttle bus (mon-sat), 10 min walk to metro and only 10 Euro in a taxi. But my impression was spoiled by the resturant. We had lunch there and it was hiddious! My husband oredered tagliatelle with wild mushrooms, but got served tagliatelle with tinned mushroom soup (yes, I swear it is true)! Below par and not what you expect in Italy... My club sandwich was dry, with chewy chicken (frozen, not fresh), horrible bacon and a bad excuse for a lettuce leaf thrown on top. I had to ask for mayo (even tho it read on the menu), and got a simple sachet of the sort. To wash it all down we had a small Peroni each. I could accept this if it had been a 2 star cheap and cheerful pleace, but not in a 4 star establishment. And the price: 60 Euro!!! Service: Horrible and grumpy old waiter, nothing done to please his customers, not even a thank you or a smile. Ruined the start of our day... So spend your money closer to the centre, cause this is not worth what they charge!! And then you can always pop out for dinner...

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good size rooms, simple breakfast”
Reviews.Author: shari C
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel room through a travel agent I liked that the hotel was off the beaten track so we got to see non touristy areas which my husband and I love to see. It was easy to walk to the Vatican and the hotel staff was helpful. The rooms where simple nothing fancy bathroom a good size reminded me of staying at a comfort inn. Breakfast wasn't my favorite, variety was fine wasn't anything special in a very special city. They need to step it up a notch otherthan that didn't have a problem with a thing

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in the Tiberio”
Reviews.Author: Tomaiathan
Reviews.Content: Me and my newlywed decided to go to Rome for a honeymoon. We found a deal for 4 nights in the Tiberio, without knowing much more. When we arrived we saw a very nice hotel (compared to others in Rome, from what we looked at) - but at a place that seemed far from the city center. It was, indeed, a bit far, but after eating Pizza & Pasta there's nothing better to do than a walk back. The hotel seemed clean and comfortable, and the room was nice as well with a big window and a comfortable bed. The main attraction, for us, was Umberto, the night clerk at the desk, that was very nice, helpful, and charming. The minute he found out it was our honeymoon he sent us a big bottle of wine to the room, on the house. The following day (Seeing as we didn't want to drink) we decided to send the bottle back. When he heard about it, he said that he'd find something to suit us. He sent us a charming fruit & candy basket, and we simply fell in love. All in all our stay was very nice, we can definitely recommend it. Downside - location, but although it's a bit far from the city center, it's pretty close to the Vatican, and well worth the quick drive. Make sure to know your way back though, because it is somewhat in a back street (we enjoyed the walk but got pretty tired on the way back, luckily we had a map). We ate once in the hotel restaurant in the evening (first night) and didn't do it again. Expensive and not well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Superb stay, lovely hotel, nice people, great vfm”
Reviews.Author: Pebble191
Reviews.Content: Single lady travelling. Excellent location for Appiano metro train, 990 bus and free hotel shuttle was great too Lovely food, bar, terrace, wifi and the rooms were good Helpful and friendly. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: JHK_15
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this hotel. After getting a bit lost finding it (it's on a back street) we were greeted with pleasant staff and a beautiful lobby. Our room on the third floor was clean and modern, with tea and coffee facilities, a TV and a large amount storage. The beds were comfy and blackout curtains allowed a good nights sleep. The breakfast in the morning was excellent, there was a huge variety of pastries, bread, meats, fruit and juices. The hotel also has a roof terrace, with seating which would be great to sit on in the summer. It is situated near bus stops, and is also a 15 minute walk away from the Vatican and Cipro metro station which takes you into the main centre of Rome. it is also possible to walk into the centre if you wish too. Overall this is a great hotel for anyone wanting a few days touring Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: KKEMPSKI
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Grand Hotel Tiberio. When we arrived, we were upgraded to a 2 bedroom suite, with a huge balcony overlooking the adorable italian neighborhood. The room was beautiful, the bathroom spacious. Everything was clean and well maintained. The included breakfasts were a quick and delicious way to fuel up before a day of touring. We ate most of our lunches out while touring, but for dinner, we stopped by the grocer (right around the corner), for some cheese, crackers, grapes, olives and nuts (and some wine) for dining al fresco on the balcony or the rooftop patio. Don't miss the rooftop patio--it's beautiful and has a view of the lit St. Peter's dome at night.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better!”
Reviews.Author: jucenbran
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with everything about this hotel which we booked as a package flight and hotel. It looked very impressive with all the trees lit up on our arrival and the reception room was lovely. Our room was everything we could have wished - maybe another pillow or a bit softer ones would be good. The beds are firm but I like that. There was a jug and tea and coffee in our room which was really great. Being in a residential area meant it was quiet all night, although we could hear the upstairs neighbours banging around some. Our room key did not turn on the power one time and I rang reception and someone came within minutes. Breakfast was fantastic with every kind of food and drink you would want. The free shuttle to the town centre was great only remember to book it in advance or it's going to be full, however, there is a bus stop a short way around the corner with regular buses and the train station a short way the other direction. We took the train out to the airport using our Roma Pass, which you should definitely buy.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: thptrek
Reviews.Content: Nothing bad nothing good. Not a great location but not terrible either. Do be forewarned that there is no Air Conditioning in the rooms. It was warm the week we were there and the rooms got hot during the day.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: CHK17
Reviews.Content: Nothing was really wrong, but nothing was impressive either. it's not far form city center but at the same time its location is very residential with a suburban feel. The night staff were not that helpful and ill-informed, one of them sent us to a restaurant which closes on Monday. I think for what it is they are a bit over-priced.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel Tiberio”
Reviews.Author: hmmbirdpat
Reviews.Content: I am not a world traveler, but this hotel was not "grand" in my estimation. Average, Yes. Location leaves a great deal to be desired compared to others I saw while touring Rome. Location might be close to Vatican, but sure isn't close to anything else. Would definitely look further if I planned return trip. Service in dining room was not grand by any means -- very slow. Nice rooftop area.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Worry!!”
Reviews.Author: Wigantravellers
Reviews.Content: When I read some of the reviews I was very wary about this hotel. Howeve,r I am pleased to say that I could find no foundation for any of the complaints I read. The ones I must particularly refute are as follows: 1.The hotel is within walking distance of the city centre but is located in a quiet suburb - I was travelling with my mother (who won't mind me saying, is no spring chicken) and we found the stroll easy. 2. There is graffiti on buildings surrounding the hotel but that is true of everywhere in Rome except the Vatican walls! It is ridiculous to take graffiti as some sort of indication of the comparitive safety of the area. We walked about the area at all times of the day and night and felt perfectly safe. 3. The free shuttle to either the Vatican or downtown is a real boon and is always prompt. 4.The breakfast buffet is the usual continental style and although nothing to write home about, there is a decent selection and plenty of it. 5. All the staff are helpful and will try their best to help you with any queries or problems. 6. There are some very nice places to eat near the hotel - particularly if you are wanting to eat where the locals do and get an authentic experience. I would especially recommend La Sagra del Vino on Via Marziale. The owner is wonderfully friendly and is equally happy to either let you choose for yourself or make recommendations. Finally, please go to this hotel in the confident knowledge that there is nothing to worry about. I appreciate that some people have unrealistic expectations and that this can colour their view of an entire stay and that some people are very easily pleased - I am neither, praise where it is due only. PS If you suffer from a non visible disability such as deafness it is vital that you take proof of your disability with you to places such as the Vatican and Colloseum as it entitles you to non-queing free entry for you and your carer. (A fantastic attitude in my book and one i wish was more prevelant in this country!)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, good service”
Reviews.Author: LilyBanter
Reviews.Content: I was a bit wary of visiting this hotel after some of the reviews. we got a good deal of about £100 per night for a double room and breakfast. we are used to travelling to cities in Europe and this was the nicest hotel we have stayed in so far. the reception has marble floors and leather sofas, the staff all said hello whenever they saw us and were very helpful with directions. Our standard room was clean and huge with a massive bed and window, airconditioning, satellite tv, minibar,ensuite. the bed was comfy and I had a good sleep every night. the shuttle service left at 9, 9.30, 10, 10.30 and 11 every day and we made use of it, I am not the fittest person and my husband and I are in our late 30's and we timed the walk to the metro as 10 mins and not much more than that to the vatican. when we got our bill and someone had used our room number to buy themselves dinner. the reception staff refunded us immediately. The breakfast was the standard continental breakfast you get in most European hotels with the juice machine. The breakfast coffee machine was annoying because if you go to rome you want to have a proper fresh coffee. you could order these from the bar for about 1.5 Euros. The one suggestion I would make is to have irons available in the rooms. there was an ironing room in the basement and an ironing service you can pay for that they return your clothes 24 hours later but I'd rather iron in my own room. Overall I enjoyed staying in this hotel and made use of the gym. I would stay here again as it is good value.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Honeymoon Stay”
Reviews.Author: MommyLovesChanel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a little over a week in January and it was great! The only problem we ran into was that the hotel had overbooked for the first night we were there, but the staff was very apologetic and immediately rebooked us in a sister hotel a little up the road, and upgraded us to a suite when we returned the next day for the remainder of our stay. The room was very clean and had a beautiful veranda that would have been great in the summertime. Let's face it folks, you CANNOT EXPECT AN AMERICAN BREAKFAST OUTSIDE OF THE UNITED STATES! I had no complaints about the breakfast, and frankly thought it was better than some of the complimentary buffets you find in the US hotels. I mean, do you seriously book based on quality of bacon and eggs?! RIDICULOUS! Most Italians don't even EAT bacon and eggs for breakfast so why the heck would they know how to make them?! We ate dinner at the restaurant in the hotel several nights and the food was good and appropriately priced. We didn't run into any trouble with the shuttle, in fact, the drivers were very good and enjoyed practicing english with us. I think the sign up is a great idea because you don't have to wait around in lines. As long as you plan out your trip and sign up for shuttles appropriately, you should have NO PROBLEM. We even walked all the way from the hotel to the OTHERSIDE of Rome, by the Colesseum, and back. It's not a terrible walk, and you should probably be doing it from all the gelato and pasta you eat there anyways. Never once did I feel unsafe walking in the neighborhood. I thought it was nice for a city neighborhood. I mean, it's not a gated community (though it does have a gate) but it certainly a FAR cry from HOOD. I think it is important to note that Italians are NOT going to go out of their way to cater to you. Many people confuse this culture with being rude, it's not that they're rude, they are just matter of fact and direct. Don't expect to be groveled upon, they do what theyre supposed to, they aren't going to care about your life story, sorry...Also, don't try to butcher their beautiful language, but don't expect EVERYONE to speak english. All in all, I think the people who had problems with this hotel are problem seekers. We had a great time-- IT'S ROME! You're wasting time if you're not!

Reviews.Title: “Our first three nights ever in Italy”
Reviews.Author: fjbenoit
Reviews.Content: We were in Italy from September 1 to 24th inclusive and stayed at this hotel for the first three nights. The first night was of our own doing and the other two were part of a Trafalgar tour. The hotel was fairly easy to get to from the airport with the directions that we had from the hotel but we had to change trains. The hotel is only two blocks from the train station. Our accommodations were adequate and we were on the second floor with direct access to the outdoor pool. Even though above ground, it suited our needs. The restaurant meals were a little pricy but the lunch that we had was very good. The included breakfast was totally acceptable. The main drawback is that the hotel is not really within walking distance of many sites, but they do operate a free shuttle and you have to reserve ahead of time. Overall, we were happy with the accommodation and the staff was receptive to our needs. The rate that we paid was 110 euros for the one night as the other nights were included in the tour.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing fancy, no major complaints”
Reviews.Author: Isky
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for five nights. It is in the middle of a residential area but very clean. The breakfast was a hot and cold buffet that was nothing to brag about. The eggs were runny but the bacon was fair. The bakery products were cold and the juice and coffee came out of a machine. One day I just asked the server to just make me some coffee! The king size bed was two twin beds pushed together and held together with king size linens. The bed was very low to the floor with only two pillows. The bathroom had hot water instantly with a good shower head. The small plasma tv screen had only three English speaking channels. The front desk had no stamps to mail letters. Two of the five days I was there the front desk had no Euros to exchange. An ATM is down the hill less than a block away. The exchange rate changes daily, but the day I got 150 Euros out of my American bank account, I looked on the internet to see that $215 was what it was exchanged for. I saw no ice machines, but the lobby bar attendant would give me ice nightly in a bowl. I broke a glass on my carpet and help to clean up came immediately. The elevators are small but quick. Two computers in the lobby were free with a code from the front desk. Taxis came quickly. When requesting a taxi, we never got one that accepted credit cards or with a driver who understood English. One of my favorite tips to friends traveling outside the US is to stop by the front desk, pick up a business card with the hotel's name/address and always show it to the taxi driver who may not speak English.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but a little too far out”
Reviews.Author: HBFFtraveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was a little small with the kids, but clean and sufficient. They had an above ground swimming pool in their back yard which was very much like a person's family pool. My kids made good use of it and met other kids from around the world. The problem is that while it is a 20-25 minute walk to the Vatican, it isn't near anything else, and the Rome metro is confusing, and you don't want to pay 20 euros for a cab one way. So in the end, we probably wouldn't stay here again, although the hotel and breakfast were fine.

Reviews.Title: “HOTEL FROM HELL! AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kenietta
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel for my parent’s Anniversary. My step father works in Afghanistan. When they prepaid for our shuttle to the airport on the last day of our trip, the shuttle driver was over 1 hour late without an explanation. When he finally did show up and my parents were in the lobby, first the clerk called my step farther away from the bags and then he called my mother and I over before we had the opportunity to load up our and belongings. Then my mother's bag with all of her documents and expensive items, her medicine for her heart failure and cash was stolen right out of the Hotel lobby 2hr before departure. NO one saw ANYTHING. The hotel staff REFUSED to call the police. They Claimed their security camera wasn't working. They rushed my parents to the US embassy and while we were there someone mysteriously knew to turn my mother's PASSPORT into the Embassy so they could leave to return to the US. Please, stay away from this hotel. This was an inside job. The employees at this hotel will watch you and try to rob you. The clerk had previously made an improper joke that my mom was the one who has the money to my step dad and then later my mom was targeted. Only her carry on was taken. None of the other luggage was touched. My step father Retired from the Airforce. My mother broke down and nearly had a heart attack because of this situation. They deserved better than this. PLEASE STAY AWAY! I love my parents. I'm writing this to warn others. My husband is Active Duty in the Navy. This is a warning for other American families, especially Military families.

Reviews.Title: “Not very good”
Reviews.Author: trippervi
Reviews.Content: We arrived for a four night stay. Got there late just as the restaurant/bar was closing. Was offered half a club sandwich at 9 euros and a heineken beer at 6 euros (outrageous). Room not too bad for the price but there was no room service. Wifi internet was said to be free but it kept cutting out and the front desk staff first tried to convince me it was my computer. The same computer that worked with similar networks with no problem in Spain and Miami (I am a telecoms engineer). Finally they said they reset something on their router and it worked...only to cut out again the next morning. This continued to happen over the next few days until it came to the point where they said I was the only one complaining and refused to reset the modem (as they claimed to be doing) again (amazing). Hot breakfast not too good. Bacon not cooked properly and eggs had a powdery look and taste. Had to settle for the fruit and rolls and cold cuts etc...which were not too bad. For dinner, my daughter ordered a well done steak...and it came to her with blood in it. After that,we ate out. On the plus side, staff were helpful in giving directions about the hotel area and the city (trains etc...). Overall I would have rated it an average hotel if not for the food and the Internet (which the front desk staff were clearly dishonest about).

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Geri H
Reviews.Content: First of all we would like to rubbish all the negative reviews about the hotel and staff. Ok some hotels are not up to expectancy for some people but this hotel is fabulous. We have not been away for six years and my husband booked this for our 5th Wedding/honeymoon as a suprise for me, so this was very special to us. After he told me i thought i would do some research and read some of the reviews and after I had i was in tears as some of them were absolutely awefull ie, rude staff,terrible food,disgusting rooms and worst of all BED BUGS!!!. Obviously with all of this I straight away emailed the hotel Manager Mr Angelo Celentano who asked me to read the overall reviews and not just the bad ones and assured us out stay would be perfect. Mr Celentano you and your hotel and staff made our holiday, a lovely gesture of champayne for our anniversary was unexpected but so kind, the rooms were spotlessly clean and airey, the conditioning was on all night (much needed as it reached 99 degrees) and oyur staff were very helpfull and polite and funny. Breakfast was well, 5 star and plenty of it. We were spoilt by the size of the bed, it was huge and not one sign of anything sharing it with us,lol.Oh and go up to the roof top terrace, amazing veiws and so relaxing after a days walking and hot sun. The area surounding the hotel was very quiet and you could walk to the Metro in 10 mins and everything is in walking distance if you wish to do so. fill up your water bottles for free at the various water fountaind dotted around, water is safe to drink and is ice cold which was a much welcome relieve. We found it cheaper to walk around on our own and nor with a guide and saved us lots of money wich you will get through like water. If you go to ST Peters DO get there about 7/7.30 am we did and had it to ourselves barr from about 70 people for an hour or so and were first up to the viewing point in the dome, be warned though the view is breath taking but its 750 steps to climb, worth paying an extra 2 Euros to pass the first 200 steps.Taxis, if you book a taxi to the hotel you will be charged straight off from where it had come from so it could work out very expensive, its cheaper to get the Metro and pay 4 euros foran all day metro/bus ticket or 1 euro to where you want to go on the metro. All in all a very special and beautifull holiday thanks to my wonderfull husband for organising it and Grand Hotel Tiberio. Final word, DO NOT be put off by the bad reviews, Ok, hotels cannot make everyone happy and I have stayed in a few I have not liked in the past but Grand Hotel Tiberio is one of the good ones, so go with confidence and enjoy every bit of your stay. Geri and David x

Reviews.Title: “best european hotel service”
Reviews.Author: marissmichigan
Reviews.Content: we came to rome to celebrate my birthday. mr celentano,the hotel manager upgraded our room as a birthday gift. what a treat. i read most of the reviews about this hotel before we left. there were more negative than positive. i have to say that we have traveled to europe a lot,and we have never received a more personal service from any other hotel except Grand Hotel Tiberio. staff was friendly, room was very clean, area is quiet yet accessible by bus or train not to mention free shuttle, wonderful breakfast. staff is always willing to help. thank you mr celentano for making my birthday memrable.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Annie B
Reviews.Content: My husband booked this as a surprise for our wedding anniversary. The hotel was just what we needed for this trip. A quiet room with a comfortable bed. The breakfast was really enjoyable and we were able to fill up for a days walking round Rome. The hotel is in a lovely residential area and we were able to get the bus just round the corner from the hotel into Rome for 1 euro. We used the hotel's shuttle service to take us to the airport. The guy who took us was really friendly and took us on a detour that allowed us to see the most faboulous views of Rome. It was something that we wouldn't have known about or seen had he of not done that. Overall a fabulous trip and lovely hotel, we will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hotel Tiberio Does Not Meet 4 Star Standard”
Reviews.Author: itstravellingbloke
Reviews.Content: Set about 15-20 mins walk from the Vatican, the location is not too bad. The walk back is harder as it is mostly uphill. GHT provides a shuttle to the Vatican & The River, but this broke down and no further provision was made. Hotel is tired looking with worn carpets and old furnishings in the lobby. Rooms are in bad need of refurbishment. Many things went wrong while we were there, notably: Hotel air con broke down for 2 days Shuttle service broke down for a week Room wasnt cleaned for 2 of the days we were there Room door wouldnt lock and then wouldnt open Pool was dirty with a scum mark around the rim Only 2 foreign channels on the TV Fridge in the room didnt work Shuttle times were messed up causing us to miss it Overall, it does not offer the services, the cleanliness or the comfort that a real 4 star should. We paid c.€109 per night. It is not worth this amount. I would only stay here if there was no alternative

Reviews.Title: “This became our home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: nadia m
Reviews.Content: Great hotel ...very professional, friendly and clean. We travelled for more than one month and came back to the Grand Hotel Tiberio three times... once with our friends and they loved it too! The breakfast was good and the restaurant was excellent. The front desk customer service was excellent...professional, very helpful and knowledgeable . The hotel is about 15 minutes from the centre of Rome...they have a shuttle but we just bought a 4Euro bus pass for the 990 bus and used it all day long. There is a supermarket just around the corner which was great. We spent an evening on the roof terrrace which was great...quiet neighbourhood great for sleeping away from the traffic of Rome. We walked 20 minutes to the Vatican. As my kids say ...All streets lead to the Grand Hotel Tiberio! We will be back in two years! nadia and family

Reviews.Title: “A decidedly amateurish hotel”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeSilverback
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Grand Hotel Tiberio with high expectations after seeing some good reviews. We were impressed with the reception and restaraunt but not with the service. Our baggage porter was 45 minutes late and left us in our room with no luggage! We stayed at the hotel and had a very enjoyable dinner. Wanting to go for a swim in the morning, we realise the pool was 10 metres long and not filled. The Hotel was good but definitely not a 4* hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in a Rome Hotel, without the Rome prices...”
Reviews.Author: Bugsbunny1973
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in December 2010. Hotel fine, room okay. Probably more 3*. Staff were friendly and were happy to provide you with directions and maps etc. My luggage was delayed and they made several calls on my behalf to the airport. Breakfast was continental but nice and filling all the same, with a good assortment of juices, pastries, cereals, and you could have eggs, toast, fruit, yoghurt's etc. People complaining about the location are mad. If you walk out of the door and down the street and around the corner (3 mins walk) you will find the train station. (Appiano) Take one or two stops (short ride couple of minutes) to Cipro station, follow the steps underground to Cipro Metro and you are then on Metro Line A and can go anywhere in Rome. Can get to Vatican in 10 mins from the hotel etc. It is in a residential area yes, but that is preferable to the touristy areas that you would pay an absolute fortune for. You can take a stroll to the local shops, I was a solo woman travelling an ddidn't feel any danger/threatened walking alone. There is a news agents, butchers and a dehli and strangely a boutique store selling Todds! Reasonably priced, good hotel that did the job.

Reviews.Title: “A bit off the beaten track”
Reviews.Author: TallTexWally
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hotel Tiberio is a decent hotel. The main problem with me was the location. It's in a neighborhood of apartment buildings, more than a mile west of Vatican City. There's a bus that stops near the hotel, and takes you about ten blocks down the hill, to where you can get on the Rome Metro at the Cipro station. I never tried the bus, since I didn't want to wait at a bus stop for awhile, and also I wasn't sure how to properly buy the bus tickets at a tobacco shop, etc. I'm sure it's simple, but I preferred walking. Still, it was a long walk. The Metro can quickly get one to the heart of Rome, but the metro doesn't go everywhere. For example, if you wanted to visit the Pantheon, you would need to find the right bus that goes there, or else be prepared for a long walk, or take a taxi, which would be expensive. I think if I could stay a week in Rome I would become familiar with Rome's bus system, and then getting around the city would not be a problem, but if you are staying just a day, as I did, it becomes a bit more problematic. In other words, if I went back to Rome, and was just staying a day or two, I would try to find a hotel within walking distance of the sights I wanted to see. If I was staying longer, and could figure out Rome's bus system, then staying at the Grand Hotel Tiberio wouldn't be a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely average, nothing special. I'm never going back!”
Reviews.Author: BasketballMama
Reviews.Content: The bare bones hotel, at least they upgraded us to a junior suite, or I would have been miserable! The room was dirty, there was crumbs next to the dresser. The bathroom was clean and looked new, but small. The pillows were not soft and the king bed was very hard. The food in the restaurant was adequate, but not great. At least the Internet was free. I had to leave at 6 am and the breakfast take away was absolute horrible and so cheap! I received the dry toast, jelly, mini pastry and a mini juice box! Where are the warm croissants? I will never stay here again and will never recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely great!”
Reviews.Author: esterstorgaard
Reviews.Content: Two days ago I googled GHT, because i miss Rome and would never stay anywhere else than at Grand Hotel Tiberio. I read some of the negative ratings and could not believe it! So I HAD to write something myself. My husband and I went to Rome in 2007 and again in 2009. We plan to go back this year and we will certainly go back to GHT. It is correct that the hotel is not situated in the middle of the city - but that is one of the many things I like about it. You can actually SLEEP at night - NO noise. And its not like the hotel is FAR away from everything; You can walk to the Vatikan City in 10-15 minutes - or You can go by bus or train. No problem at all! The rooms are clean and neat, the restaurant is great - please try the anti-pasti! Do NOT miss the terrace at the roof. It is GREAT! Also the Hotel has a lovely outside space next to the restaurant where You can injoy a cup of coffee or a glass of wine. The hotelstaff is awsome! Whenever we needed something - they would provide! In 2007, our son was going on a tour with the Copenhagen Boys Choir, we went to Rome to hear him and his friends. Sankt Peters Church we were able to find ourselves :-D but the church of Andrea de la Valle?! In Rome it seems everybody has a church EACH...We asked the lovely ladies at the reception - an since they did'nt know, they called colleques at other hotels - and after consulting their colleques, they drew a map for us - with all the busconnections we needed! They found adresses for restaurants we wanted to visit, made reservations for us, helped us in anyway. I cannot recommend this hotel enough! The waiters, the cleaners the receptionists are not just staff - they are PEOPLE. Ready to help, joke, talk and make Your stay in Rome perfect! Greetings from Denmark

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: californialoving
Reviews.Content: After having stayed here in march with my boyfriend I will def not make a return visit. Sort out your horrible, rude blonde receptionist. Not a hello, smile or anything. This lady was the hotels first impression. The next morning was the exact same with her. Staring me out does not suffice as a hello. The hotel staff found it hard to understand us even when we tried to speak italian and laughed in our faces. The only upside was the room was lovely. Food we hated. A trip we won't forget for the wrong reasons.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Service,”
Reviews.Author: meegreen
Reviews.Content: A little off the beaten track , so you must plan for transportation for your ride back depending on where you are in Rome. We were a large group and cabs were a bit on the expensive side. As far as the hotel goes, it was good. It was clean enough, quiet enough, rooms were okay looking could use a face lift on decor a little dated. The bar and Restaurant staff were very good, they kept the kitchen open late for us one night as we got in late and didnt have dinner yet. Food was good enough, breakfast was decent. The front desk were helpful, they answered questions but didn't wow us with warmth however we arrived early and our rooms were ready that was a plus. They just were not warm and fuzzy. Very matter of fact with a smile is the best way i could describe them. They did send us to a wonderful place for dinner Cosellos very close to them. Computer access was free and there was a very nice large lobby to gather and hang in as you planned your day or ended your night. Bar made a good cup of American coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean pleasant hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Mg1903
Reviews.Content: Yesterday I returned from a 3 day city break in Rome. I arrived at the Grand Hotel Tiberio on Friday night. The reception area looks pleasant very clean modern and spacious. We were given our allocated room which was less than impressive, a double bed had been asked for and we had two singles that were in a poor state of repair. The beds had been pushed together. I complained at reception and immediately my room was changed to a much nicer one, begging the question why was I given the duff one when a good one was available?? That said, the staff were excellent and very accommodating throughout the trip. The breakfast was continental, but good. The restaurant menu was was very good and the food was good quality. The restaurant is a 15 minute walk from St Peters Square, and some of these reviews will mention the grafitti and general state of disrepair of the surrounding area, but having walked through Rome it seems to be a dirty, messy city which looks like it needs a good clean! I would recommend the GHT for its value for money. Incidentally there is a tube station nearby and a cab into the town centre costs around 10 euros. Enjoy your stay, ps the Vatican museum and Sistine chapel is free to guests on the last Sunday of the month!

Reviews.Title: “Stay at your own risk”
Reviews.Author: TimandKath
Reviews.Content: Outside of hotel and the lobby look good. Inside the room not so nice (room 410). Room is a decent size. Ceiling is about 4m high, which makes the full length curtains look a bit “churchy”. One wall has marks all over it from shoes and other suitcases. The bed is a little lumpy but a nice size. There is a large desk with a mini bar fridge. TV has sky (paid TV). Nice amount of wardrobe space. In-room safe. Bathroom tidy but fittings are not installed properly. Hand soap rails are loose, sink is not level. Shower pressure ok but not good. Hotel staff are stupid. We pre-paid €15 a day for parking and were told to park on the side of the hotel (behind gates) but still easily seen or accessible from the train station or road. Noticed there was undercover parking (boom gate) to the left of the hotel, asked about this and was told we park in the open space still. Went back later to see a different receptionist and he said that the area was fine but when we said we had pre-paid for undercover parking, he checked the system and saw we had. He told us how to get access to the undercover parking which we did. Not much parking down there as there was a lot of chairs and other hotel items being stored there. It was very difficult to manoeuvre into a position which is probably why they don’t like people parking down there. We were informed about the free shuttle bus from hotel to Vatican City/City Centre. It only runs every 1.5 hours and only has one return service. Also the bus holds only 5 or 7 people at a time. The first time we tried booking we were told it was full. So we booked it for the next day and we were told they were the last seats available. The next day, no one else turned up so it was only us in the bus. No doubt other people had been turned away. It was a very scary trip to the city and we feared for our lives (with good reason as the van was more than a little beat up). Best thing to do is to catch bus 990 to Piazza Cavour from just down the road. Purchase a ticket from a ticket machine near the bus stop or tobacconists everywhere before boarding as you can’t buy a ticket from the driver. €1 for 75mins anywhere in Rome. Breakfast is reasonable – no hot food, only cold meat or cheese plus the usual cereal, bread etc. The restaurant for dinner was ok also. Service for the hotel was generally poor. In our room there was no information booklet for the hotel services on offer. When we told the receptionist about this he looked at us like we were crazy – kept saying ‘in your room’, but it wasn’t. We ended up giving up. Internet was available in the lobby for €1.90 for half an hour. Rooms not very soundproof – we had Italians next door who kept slamming doors and arguing until well after midnight each night. Neighbourhood doesn’t seem too bad but still looks dirty as does anywhere in Rome. 20 or 30 minute easy walk to the Vatican City. We left some items there and rang to see if they were found. ‘No, nothing found’. Another words the cleaners decided to keep them for themselves. We wouldn’t stay at this hotel again. Overall satisfaction 4 out of 10.

Reviews.Title: “Average...”
Reviews.Author: Checkin25
Reviews.Content: We decided to choose hotel because it looks good and comfortable. Not too far away from Rome centre. There was also bus stop nearby which goes to the nearest metro station. Upon arrival the front desk was very nice and helpful even it was late night. When we were leaving there was a computer with printer so we were able to do a online check-in very easily! And we get a very good map from front desk too. Hotel room was pretty small because from pictures it looks more larger. It was also little dissapointment cause there was some little dirt in sheets. Well, it was so small dirt that we didn´t want to change it. Another mind sharp thing was that cleaners did not change sheets every day ( Oh yes, we had that tag in the door). They just only turn sheets round thats all. Couple of days after they luckily change sheets completely. I really not sure, but I think there was then some other cleaner... However, room was fine cause we didn´t spend much time there. Very nice thing that there was a free breakfast including. Breakfast was good and so on good value for money. There was yogurt, good rolls, croissants, some cakes and of course coffee. So, breakfast was very nice except one morning there was a little bit exceptional thing. When we were taking some croissant there was ants under of croissants?! So we didn´t eat croissants anymore...

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay...”
Reviews.Author: cajmaine
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried about staying at this hotel for the distant to the attractions and yes it is a bit out of the way but we took the hotel shuttle a few times and taxis most of the other times since we had a party of 8. But neighborhood is nice and felt safe walking around. Wi Fi worked in the rooms for my family members that needed it. The hotel staff was wonderful and the rooms clean and fair size. Breakfast was fine. We tried the dining room one night and that was not good, service was indiffrent and food was not up to standards I expected but that is the ONLY negative about the hotel that I have. Loved Rome and glad we stayed at Grand Hotel Tiberio.

Reviews.Title: “How to interpret Tripadvisor reviews!”
Reviews.Author: RoertWaite
Reviews.Content: Ignore the extreme reviews and use commonsense, and Tripadvisor is a bargain hunters best friend! The reviews for this hotel sum this up! Just back from a great 4night stay at this hotel, with a party of 7 occupying 3 rooms. In the UK this would be a top end 3 Star. Staff were great and very helpfull - booked airport transfers far cheaper than we could do itl. Hotel is in a residential area (with a lot of graphite) but we never felt threatened, walking around at night with 2 children. Local restaurants are limited, but those recommended by the hotel were excellent. Breakfast was fine, but could have done with some fresh fruit.Yes the hotel is outside the very centre of Rome, but the mainline station is next to the hotel, and the Metro is only an interesting 15mins walk. Rooms/bathrooms were fine. Fitness suite was basic, but ok. Sauna is extra. If you want a good quality hotel in Rome at a very fair price, book it. If you want to walk out the front door, and be in the centre of Rome, then pay three times as much and book somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “No value for money at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: percmelbourne
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 4 nights , the rooms so small , the staff at front desk not very helpful. The breakfast cakes where stale ... I wouldnt stay at this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: ynttrvl
Reviews.Content: The hotel was close to the train and bus, but it was a distance from most of the city center. However, it was fairly close to the Vatican. The hotel is located in a residential area and there really aren't many restaurants or any type of nightlife. The rooms were a decent size (by European standards) and clean. I would recommend this hotel to people who don't mind navigating the train or bus system and who don't mind doing a lot of walking! If you keep in mind that this is a budget hotel and don't set your expectations too high, then you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel, value oriented, but not best location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Didier_Six
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on its value - decent rooms, in Rome, breakfast buffet included. While it was ok, if we had to do it over again, we would probably choose one closer to the core of the city. The rooms were decent but not overly spacious. It felt like staying in a Quality Inn in the US. The breakfast was quite good, but don't expect to get eggs/bacon, it really is a continental spread. It was good to fill up before we headed out to the attractions. While we did walk to the Vatican (10 min), by the end of the day, we took the bus back because it was too hot and too far to get back to. To get to Termini station take the Appiano train for one stop towards Rome, then take the A line 8 stops. The Appiano station is just around the corner from this hotel. The beds were firm and clean. The lobby staff were for the most part helpful, but it seemed like we were bothering them when we asked for basic things like directions. I think they need to remember that they are in a service business and most visitors are not used to getting around in a country where perhaps they don't speak the language. The good news is that English seems to be the unofficial second language so most people you speak to can actually help you to get to where you want to go. While there is a pool, it is a small one and well suited for young kids to cool off in (3 ft deep). But, if we were to do it over, this hotel is really too far away to feel like you are near the main attractions in central Rome. To get to any area we had to take the 990 bus and then transfer to either another bus or subway to get to where we wanted to go.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: TravelDeFamly
Reviews.Content: My Family stayed here, Fabulous rooms, Location was clase to train & bus, Breakfast was very good. Dinner was horrible and overprice. they have a free shuttle to the vatican and center of town, free wi-fi, this hotel exceeded our expectations in evey category But Dinner.

Reviews.Title: “horrible stay!!! could not wait to leave!”
Reviews.Author: TweetyBIrd5
Reviews.Content: my husband and i spent 3 nights there and it was one of our worse stay ever!. the room was fine but the location is horrible! There is no way you can walk to a restaurant for dinner because around the hotel is very ghetto and looks basically like a ghost town. The restaurant at the hotel sucked. I ordered a shrimp risotto n ive never tasted shrimp like this before in my entire life. It was absolutely frozen shrimp!. DISGUSTING! and it really sucked that i had to pay for a meal like that!. They do have wi fi but its always getting disconnected and you have to constantly call front desk to reset it. When it does get "reset" it still doesnt work so who knows if they actually do reset it!. The rooms are also very noisy! Overall i would not recommend this hotel. Staying at this hotel made me hate italy and I will never return ever again!. DO NOT STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs-would never go back”
Reviews.Author: syoon10
Reviews.Content: Both my husband and I got multiple bed bug bites (I had 40 bites!). Our trip to Italy was significantly inconvenienced by this. The rash was extremely itchy and painful and lasted 3 weeks. We threw out our largest luggage bag and dry cleaned and/or hot water washed all of our clothing. The hotel did not care at all and took no responsibility at all. It was a terrible experience and would never recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “It was a perfect start to our trip”
Reviews.Author: MarcofromLA
Reviews.Content: We stayed from June 12-15, 2010. Two parents and two teenage kids. It was great. Big room. Everyone had a bed. Good AC. Good service at the front desk. Great breakfast each day. Super easy parking. Even though the hotel is away from the main sights, the neighborhood is upscale and very quiet. So we liked the change from the main areas. We could call a cab each day, which never took longer than about 3 minutes, and go anywhere within a few short minutes. We had a car and still used cabs to avoid parking. It worked out great and we loved everything about this hotel. It was a great start to our 2 week vacation.

Reviews.Title: “What wi-fi?”
Reviews.Author: UpInTheAir27
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very good but the wi-fi signal in the rooms is so low that you need to be in the lobby (closer to the router) to have a decent connection. Breakfast is spectacular!

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough hotel but a bad location...”
Reviews.Author: CaliGirl521
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice room that was large and comfortable with a nice bathroom. The hotel itself was very nice but the location was not. The AC worked great. The metro was nearby as well as a bus station but it took awhile to get to the city center. They have a hotel shuttle but you have to make a reservation and that just doesn't work for us very well because we're not very scheduled people. If you're just going to the Vatican then this hotel is a good location but if you're going anywhere else in Rome you'll find that you'll be on the bus and metro a lot and walking anywhere interesting is basically out of the question. Other than location my only other complaint about the hotel was the food. The breakfast was standard and not too terrible...although their juice machine produced a red fruit punch instead of orange juice which I found amusing. We had dinner there one night at the hotel and paid way too much or substandard food. The wine was good and cheap though! We vowed not to eat there again but we came back to the hotel one afternoon to shower and change for the evening and found ourselves stuck inside due to pouring down rain...normally we would've sucked it up and gone out in the rain but it was day 12 or travelling and we just weren't up for the challenge...needless to say we were stuck with room service for dinner. This time we knew what to avoid but it still wasn't great. As first time visitors to Rome we booked a place we thought was a good price and location, but now that we've been there we wouldn't stay at this location again. Although the rooms were nice and the service was good, we wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice price, unenjoyable experience”
Reviews.Author: MasterP8
Reviews.Content: The rooms were nice, the staff was cold and unfriendly. I look for hotels where the staff is helpful and makes it easier for me to travel in unknown territory. I thought this hotel would make it easy for us to get around, but their claim as being close to a metro stop is generous to say the least. Their directions to the metro were inadequate to say the least and if we didn't have a compass we would never have made it. Breakfast was included and pretty good. It's the only reason they get 2 stars from me. I would not return unless there was no other choice. This hotel could have been worse, but I would look for one which can substantiate its claims to 4 stars. Nothing 4 star about this hotel but the lobby and the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing, considering reviews”
Reviews.Author: theskipperxxx
Reviews.Content: Girlfriend booked this room in Rome knowing it was a distance from the sites but based on a couple of wants for a 4 Star hotel......a balcony overlooking Rome (description given by the booking agency) and wireless in room for free (needed for airline bookings, in-touch to home and sightseeing plans). Got to hotel and got minimal help from front desk staff as to what was offered by hotel (compared to other hotel staff on this trip). Room was relatively expensive and our balcony (2nd floor) overlooked apartment buildings. Hmm, we could deal with that. Room was clean, and large enough, with a nice bathroom with twin sinks. Breakfast was adequate, but not close to the best we had on our trip (in a four star for a great deal less money) Tried wifi in room and for the first evening had super slow connectivity (virtually unusable), then could not connect for the remainder of our three days in Rome. Asked staff about this and was given vague answers as "we have an issue but it's being looked at" to an outright fib "the whole area is down for internet". When we asked about some sort of compensation, the front desk staff was adamant that since it wasn't their equipment yet the whole area they had no reason to do anything. When we asked to see the manager later, suddenly our room was called and they allowed us to use their office computer to access the web.....(so obviously the internet in the area was not down, but just the hotel'srouter/ wifi equipment). Extremely poor customer service combined with a a so-so experience for the overall stay makes this a non-recommend for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Rip Off”
Reviews.Author: nan88
Reviews.Content: Our group stayed at the Grand Tiberio. Everyone in our group was given a rate of 159 euros per night. My bill had a different rate each night ranging from 112 to 365 euros a night. I paid an average of 191 euros a night. The manager said since I booked online at a later date I had to pay that rate and he would not give me the group rate even though he told our group leader that he would. He said it was too late. It cost us 50 euros to get back to this hotel one day. It is too far from anything and in general a rip off.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Good Place, Clean”
Reviews.Author: IA-Mom-07
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Hotel Tiberio Via Lattanzio, 51 00136 Roma Italia Tel. +39.06.399629 April 17th-April 21st. It was VERY nice, Clean and very well Staffed. You Do however have to pay to use the Computers/ Business Area. The Staff was nice, but needs to explain things a Little Clearer to USA quests. The directions are great on the Website. It is very close to the Train Station and a Market and a Bar where you can purchase your Train, Tram Tickets puchase the 3 day Tourist Metro Ticket There or at the Metro and You can get any where in the City for only 11.00 Euro's. The Breakfast was a Continental but for 3.99 Euro's Extra you can order from their Menu. The Bar / Restaurant was inside the Hotel. Good Price for my 2nd, 3rd, 4th nights of Stay. The first night was Way more. I had book on line. for one night. but due to Volcano Extended it. I meet some really Terrrific People there from the USA and Germany. It was a Great Place to stay and Very Safe. I highly recommend it Make sure you get a Map from the Front Desk and a Bus Schedule and Train Schedule. And Be patient. when site seeing. I would recommend contacting the Hotel to book Reservation. Not Expedia or Cheap Tickets.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel near the Vatican”
Reviews.Author: Clark_W_Grisswold
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent booked us in this hotel. The facilities were very nice as were the rooms. The service was not great, but the rest was pretty good. The breakfast was pretty good; lots of options. The location was remote from the city center but only a 2 block walk from a train station where you could access all the sites. This property is in a residential neighborhood so it's very quiet, watch out for the dog poop that covers the sidewalks as a result.

Reviews.Title: “Long Distance”
Reviews.Author: hannigan007
Reviews.Content: As mentioned in a lot of previous reviews this hotel is located a good distance away from the major sights of Rome so I would not recommend this hotel for the elderly or people who do not like walking. There is a metro station around the corner from the hotel (Appiano) which will bring you to the majority of sights and a ticket costs €11 for 3 days so is well worth purchasing. You can buy a ticket from the bar next to the station. The area where the hotel it located is quite rough and we did have to pass through a gang of youths drinking at the side of the road on our way home one night. There are not many bars or restaurants located close to the hotel so again using the metro to get to the centre of things may be your best option for a night out. The hotel itself is by no means a 4 star, I would give it 3 at best. Some of the staff are really friendly whereas the bar staff can be quite rude. Food in the hotel is good and inexpensive but drinks are pricey like everywhere in Rome. The rooms are nice and clean with a mini bar and Sky TV. The bathroom is average size with a good shower/bath, there is also free wifi in the rooms. The breakfast in the morning consists of cereals, cold meats and cheeses, fruit yoghurts etc. The hotel offers a free courtest bus, which must be booked, to the Vatican also. Overall this is a nice hotel but I would not stay here again due to the location.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, far from sites.”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel_whoohoo
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Rome and so our goal was to see as much of Rome (Vatican, Ruins, Spanish steps, Trevi Fountain) as possible. I wished we would have stayed in a hotel closer to these sites as we spent a good amount of money just on cabs alone (and we walked a lot). The hotel staff was acceptable, not very warm. Room was fine but I would classify it as 3 star at best. television had minimal, hazy channels. Shower was extremely tiny. The bed was slightly more firm for my preference. Breakfast pretty good. (no hot breakfast but plenty of deli meats, toaster for breads, cappucino makers, different cereals, juices).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Value in Rome - a bit of a hike from Vatican”
Reviews.Author: moha0018
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for abour 3 days in July of 2008. Very well done hotel with spacious lobby, excellent rooms, helpful staff and internet. The hotel is owned by the Vatican so they pride on keeping it very clean. The hotel is in a quiet neighborhood with very little traffic noise. Most rooms have a gorgeous balcony and the continental breakfast is simply awesome. The only drawback is that this is about a 1.5 mile (2.4 KM) walk from the Vatican and other sites. The hotel has a free shuttle from 9 am to 5 pm. Shuttle comes every 1.5 hours. The walk is not bad especially if you want to see Rome's sights at night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but absolutely not 4*”
Reviews.Author: bobbanek
Reviews.Content: We stayed there two nights and was quite satisfied. But be warned to pay for the room Deluxe. It is nothing special. There is one more room as living room but it´s very small and dark. We did not use it at all and the balcony with a nice wiew is just wiew to the railway tube and parking. Breakfast was fine. Location of this hotel is not good for going to the centre or Vatican on foot. The Metro station is about 15 minutes walking. Bus stop is near the hotel. We had problem to find some restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy, Good experience all round”
Reviews.Author: frenchiefan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a New years sight seeing trip Dec 28 - Jan 3 2010 with our 16 year old daughter and her friend. We did not do much research as we booked on a lark and this hotel was selected on expedia and by our travel agent as it had a good price and breakfast was included. We were later a bit nervous as we read it was closer to the vatican then the city centre - but it worked out to be just great. It was in a quiet residential safe area and it was peaceful for sleeping. Everything was handy with a grocery steps away. The bus was outside the door and there are a couple of good restaurants near by. Nuraghe Sardo and Sagro del'vino. We did not dine at the hotel so are unable to comment. It was just fine for us.. the girls seemed very happy with their room and it was quite comfortable and large by European standards, equipped with bath shower combo. inexpensive internet access in the lobby. The hotel lent us power converters and everyone we encountered were pleasant and helpful. the room was very clean. We enjoyed the healthy choices at breakfast - cereal yogurt juice and fruit..there were also eggs , ham and loads of delicious pastries. It was easy to get around via bus # 990 to Cavour bridge then bus 87 into the core..or just walk to over the bridge to popolo of campo fiori. Buy bus tickets at local Tabcherie..1 euro for a 90 minute ride or when you get to cavour or metro you can buy a 4 day pass for 11 euro. The staff were very helpful and we used their car service to and fro the airport. We emailed prior to the trip and it was seemless. All in all i would recommend this hotel based on our experience. PS Took a good vatican tour with 7 hills tours. They are on the web.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: georgerosado
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Italy and I didnt know what to expect. I read the reviews of Hotel Tiberio prior to booking, some were good and some were bad. I figuered I would take my chances. Please note that I intentionally wanted to be away from ROME CITY CENTER and away from all the tourists. I wanted to be with the locals. The hotel was ideal for me. The hotel is very modern, the front desk were very friendly and all spoke perfect English. The rooms were very clean, comfortable and safe. The bathrooms were very modern and acceptable. The hotel had an outdoor patio on the rooftop which I found extremely charming, with lots of seating cozy space, plants and trees. The continental breakfast was ok, nothing spectacular, but for your morning coffee and a pastry it was acceptable. What I loved about the hotel was that it was in a residential street and just around the corner of the hotel was an amazing bakery/deli....OMG, I would go there everyday and stock up on my daiy goodies! Also, there was a lively pub about 5 minutes walking distance. About 10 minutes on bus to the vatican and local shops for shopping...... Ok, so the bad thing about the hotel.......if you like going to the city center ROME, it was far.....and at night, the bus stopped running around 10pm....which meant you had to take a cab and from the city center it was about 25 euros. But other than that, I totally would stay here again........oh also, the hotel had internet high speed and computers for 2 euros for 1 hour. so, no need to bring your own lap top So, if you want a great hotel, clean and reasonably priced......I recomend this one!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a wonderful area”
Reviews.Author: gchanese
Reviews.Content: I returned from my honeymoon this week and had a wonderful experience with this hotel. I was able to communicate with the general manager of the hotel prior to our arrival and he was very accomidating. We had arrange, through the hotel, for a private car to pick us up at the airport which cost only 10 Euro more then a cab would have. When we arrived the general manager that I had been in contact with met us and knew exactly who we were which was very nice. Our room was on the 5th floor and had a private balcony. The room was very nice and clean and the bathroom was extremely nice. The breakfast the hotel supplies for free was great and very filling. There is a free shuttle that dropped us off at the city center and we are able to walk around the entire city. For dinner we would travel around neighborhood and find little shops to eat which with all great. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone that doesn't want to stay in the middle of the city.

Reviews.Title: “to be a 4 stars... it's very short...”
Reviews.Author: Alec_Satow
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not up to my expectations! Staff seems always nervous... always running... low quality breakfast, room was ruined.. Then, on the down floor there is something should be a "wellness center"... I just found a out-dated steam room, and a stinky shower! ok, that's all... I have been clear!

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hotel Tiberio”
Reviews.Author: TraceyT2
Reviews.Content: Was within walking distance of St Peters Square, but not a lot of restaurants nearby. Breakfast was fine, but the two times I ate dinner at the hotel I was not overly impressed. The rooms were nice. I enjoyed having a bathtub/shower combo. Was traveling by myself and felt perfectly safe. Small grocery store down the block.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with excellent service in Rome”
Reviews.Author: dgaleher
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Rome and stayed in a wonderful hotel Grand Hotel Tiberio. It was off the beaten path but a short bus ride to the Vatican. The hotel also offers a shuttle service. The breakfast was very good with a wide variety of foods. We ate in the restaurant one evening and had a pleasant meal. The staff recommended a very good restaurant a few blocks away and we really enjoyed that. Everyone at the hotel spoke english. There were several grocery stores nearby that had excellent olives and great prices on beer that my niece enjoyed. There was a lounge area on the roof that was very pleasant. I would stay here again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for a good price.”
Reviews.Author: bluecarrot
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and well maintained. The staff were courteous and always willing to help in whatever way they could. We had a good sized room with a decent bathroom and a small balcony overlooking some grassy area and quite a few houses and apartment buildings. This hotel was nice and the breakfast was quite good, but the hotel is a fair distance from anything you might want to do as a tourist. Its proximity to the subway stop makes it fairly easy to get into town, but I found it a bit weird to be in the middle of a residential area. Most people would probably PREFER to be out of the hustle and bustle I suppose.

Reviews.Title: “We Melted!”
Reviews.Author: CHECKER148
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in mid September. We wanted to see Rome before a 13 day cruise of the mediteranian. The front desk was polite, the bellman, Joseph was very nice. The rooms were so-so. Nothing special. Beds were very low and hard as a rock!. The main gripe I had with this hotel is the lack of airconditioning. I thought we were going to suffocate. we had brought our travel fan and electric outlet converter, however, it promptly blew up the fan as soon as we plugged it in. My husband searched everywhere for another fan. We finally had to open the window. And let me tell you, they are huge and very heavy. The breakfast buffet was very good. Plenty to choose from. We all got plenty to eat to start the day. Maybe if you go in the fall or winter it would be more comfortable for sleeping. For the price, I wish the airconditioner would have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ayoungone
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at Hotel Tiberio, It was as good as expected from reviews given, nice sized room, good bathroom, The rooms were cleaned daily,staff were very helpfull and polite, Breakfast was amazing, there was\a selection of everything you could think of and you could help yourself to as much as you wanted except for full cooked breakfast which was at a small cost, we returned each night for a main meal as the food was so good, a little expensive but worth every penny, they even do non Italian food for the unadventurous. The hotel is a little way out of the city, a good 30 minute walk to the Vatican and 45 minutes to the edge of the City if you dont mind walking, or a 15 minute walk to the nearest metro Cipro, there is a bus stop around the corner if you don't or can't walk bus 990, public transport is fairly cheap and regular, only disapointment was that the only rooms that have tea/coffee making facilities are the delux and wifi/internet access isn't free nor is the use of the sauna, but you should not be in the hotel long enough to worry about this. We would definitely return to Rome and use this hotel again!!

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: TabFuerteventura
Reviews.Content: Hotel a bit further away from city, but still reachable if you are not afraid of walking. Local buses run every 10/15 minutes and are cheap, local train station around the corner. We did not eat dinner in the restaurant, but breakfast was excellent. A couple of very good, local (prices) restaurants only 2 or 3 minutes walk away, so good we visited one twice. Room we were allocated could do with a bit of decoration, but was acceptable for a short stay. Advertised as having tea/coffee making facilities in the room, but not in ours!!! Free shuttle bus good idea but as it was only an 8 seater mini bus, gets booked up very quickly. The Limo service(at extra cost) back to the airport was excellent and finshed off a very good city break, without the hassle of getting back to airport

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: itstherealthing
Reviews.Content: This hotel may be more in a residential area, but there is very easy access to the local bus line which takes you directly to the piazza just a minutes walk outside of the Vatican. Good access to the tour buses, tons of restaurants, Vatican Museum. The tour bus drops you right off at the ruins. Very good continental breakfast and super dinners at the hotel restaurant. Internet access available for a nominal fee (1 Euro for 30 minutes). I would definately stay here again. The train to the metro is close but runs with no regularity.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value!”
Reviews.Author: MauiTom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the GHT June 25-28 and enjoyed our stay. The hotel is located near (NOT WALKING DISTANCE) the Vatican in a quiet residential area. The local commuter train is right around the corner with trains every 15 minutes to a Metro station that you can take anywhere you want to go, Try and avoid rush hours beacuse the trains can get overcrowded. I would advise against driving in Rome because there seem to be no rules and street signs are few and far between. Yes the queen bed was two twins put together but for what we paid (90 euro a night) during the summer season the room met our expectations. Free wifi if you have a laptop for your whole stay. We would recommend this hotel and come back.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Polonia60
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel based on a package they offered in early 2009. We thought the staff was friendly, quite helpful, and very punctual. The service in the restaurant was excellent. Our room was nice-no view but we had not expected a view. We spent most of our time touring the wonderful city. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Go to Rome- but don't stay at Grand Hotel Tiberio!”
Reviews.Author: ZephyrKat
Reviews.Content: Grand Hotel Tiberio was the worst part of our trip! The staff was rude and barely able to conceal their disdain. The room was definitely NOT a 4 star by any means, and whenever we made a request- it was ignored. I can only assume that they don't like north American guests. It was definitely NOT the Italy that I expected! Thank goodness everyone else and the city itself was so amazing! :) Go to Rome! But don't stay at Grand Hotel Tiberio!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant vibe, poor location, service rushed”
Reviews.Author: BirminghamAnonymous
Reviews.Content: Next to a mainline station, but infrequent service out of hours. Had to walk twice, from nearest Metro 15mins away. Only views are across and into adjacent residential flats. Carpet in our room looked tired. Public areas and facilities are excellent. Breakfast also fab - as much as you can eat. Front desk staff seemed to miss the customer service bit. Everything seemed rushed. Would recommend it, with above caveats. Would not stay again myself, due to location.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy hotel”
Reviews.Author: TANILIAS
Reviews.Content: We have stayed for three nights me, my husband and one couple (friends) and I would like to say that was not bad for the purpose we want. Rome is so wonderful, romantic and a lot of places to see so we went to our room only for sleep and for breakfast (which was great). We have arranged before to rent a car so the location of the hotel was not really a big problem for us because we did not walk or take cab (expensive!!) or bus/metro. But for others would be a problem because it is a bit far away from everything.... I would recommend it for business trip as a great location. Last the hotel was average for me (small rooms-old made bathrooms - not really clean) and I rate it for 3* and propose immediate reconstraction (face-lift). Also we booked it with a great deal at night so I think that It was everything we want for our wonderful trip in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “nice and quiet, close to Vatican, would definitely stay there again”
Reviews.Author: CalcioMD
Reviews.Content: I was breezing through Rome on my way to wedding in Sicily. Decided to stay here for two reasons: (1) was traveling alone (meeting my husband in Sicily) and didn't want to deal with noise/traffic of central Rome and (2) because I was determined to finally see the Sistine Chapel (after more than 5 visits to Rome). In the past, I have overslept (partying too late) and missed getting to the Sistine Chapel before the cut off time. Very short distance to Vatican ( I finally made it!) and in quiet neighborhood (read: no nightlife nearby).
