No metropolitana stop nearby (subway), but there is a commuter train station that is very close and you can transfer to the subway. Had a nice double room with terrace which had a decent view. Found food to be pretty good in the restaurant. Will definitely stay there again with my husband the next time we are in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel/Bad Location”
Reviews.Author: ldlcal
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, Bad location. Great rooms. Very large. Good variety at Breakfast. Wonderful service. BAD BAD BAD location. It was so far from everything. It is on the far side of Vatican City. Nothing is really in walking distance and cabs out that far were outraegous!!

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to end my European tour....”
Reviews.Author: filo02
Reviews.Content: After spending one and a half weeks traveling thru Europe...this hotel was a nice place to land at for the last days in our trip. The hotel is away from the center of Rome but it is 10 min away from the Vatican City. The room was quite large for it being a European room....It was quite noisy but it didnt bother me. I would be very tired once I got to the room and the beds are comfortable. The restaurant in the hotel is very good and priced good also. YOu do have to pay to get more channels than originally you are allowed on the tv and IT IS WORTH IT!! Overall, the hotel is a very nice place to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: bubbles66Ireland
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from Rome and I stayed for 6 nights at this 4* hotel!!I would not recommend this hotel.I changed room 3 times firstly due to the fact that the room was right beside the lift very noisy,then air conditioning was not working and toilet & minibar were leaking & thirdly noise.The walls are paper thin.I choose this hotel as I thought with it being outside the city it would be quieter.The housekeeping is sloppy,things are not replaced & minibar was restocked.Some of the staff were very rude.However I would like to mention Ghia & Simon ( Food Service )who were very friendly & helpful.Some of the reception staff ( Ladies!! )need a lesson in manners.They were sniggering & very rude.The male members of the reception team were helpful & professional.I was leaving at 7am but was told by reception I could grab some breakfast before I left,I met a very rude waiter who told me coffee was all I could have dispite the fact the buffet was all laid out.Having paid for a 4* I was disappointed.Rome is a wonderful city but unfortunately for me I did not get much rest at night so for what its worth stay in the centre of Rome.Take good walking shoes as you need to walk to see Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good spot”
Reviews.Author: ryan_knapton
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel rather early, so we got a good price. The hotel is a 4*, which after travelling around Europe for 6 weeks, I cannot disagree with. It has a kettle, fridge, good sized bed, decent bathroom and nice air con. Breakfast is nothing to write home about, but filling and tasty nonetheless. There is an overland train station a 2 min walk away, which is connected to the metro. Day passes include metro and overland trains in Rome, so the fact that it is not a metro stop is irrelevant. Not a honeymoon hotel, but if you get a good price that does not offend you, the slight out-of-town location is not a problem at all.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed at better”
Reviews.Author: Rohara
Reviews.Content: The not so Grand Hotel Tiberio. This hotel is listed as a 4 star but I would find it hard to give it a 3 star rating. We arrived in Rome early evening on the 25/08/2008 staying for 4 nights. I arranged for a private transfer to the hotel with Airport-Shuttle.com which I had found on the net, no problems there, the driver didn’t speak English but that was ok, it’s about a 30 minute drive & cost us €90 for the return trip, you pay the driver cash, a taxi is about the same price & it was worth it for a ride in a nice Mercedes. When we arrived we were advised that our room was a basic one but there was an upgrade available, a superior room which also had a balcony (room 509), seeing both we decided to upgrade at an extra cost of €35 per night, this room was advertised as €295 per night on the hotel charges list so it should have been a good one. The electricity works by inserting your room key in a slot on the wall, ours worked with or without the key so that was a good start. Now for the bad bits, the shower head was all rusty, the shaving mirror had a crack the full length of it, the floor was wooden and every time you went out on to the balcony the edging strip came away, the kettle lead didn’t reach the power point so you had to stand it on the floor to use it, house keeping cleaned the room daily but I still found personal items that the previous occupants had left behind & they should have replenished the milk etc each day but they didn’t. This is a good one, there is SKY TV in the room, I was told there was only 1 English Channel but the cheek is they charge you €5 to activate it, I have never paid for TV before and I wasn’t going to start now. The air conditioning was working but it makes a hell of a noise, you couldn’t sleep with it on and with it off all you could hear was a low droning noise which was almost as bad, I’m glad we were only there for 3 days I couldn’t put up with it for two weeks! We took a look at the gym but all we found were painters redecorating the area by the lift. The good bits, the hotel offers a courtesy bus to take you into Rome, it leaves at 9:00, 9:45 & 10:30 with a pick up at 6:00pm if you need it, the minibus holds 8 & fills up fast so you need to book it at reception the day before, early. When I say they will pick you up at 6:00 it was more like 5:40 and they don’t wait so I would get there by 5:30 if you don’t want to miss it. You can get the bus (990) It takes about 10 minutes and stops by the Vatican wall, you get the bus tickets from the local bar, tobacco shop, you can’t get them on the bus, the nearest bar is out of the hotel and turn left, at the bottom of the road (50 yards) turn left, its 30 yards up on the left, the tickets cost €1 for a single trip of up to 75 minutes or €4 for an all day ticket, to validate the ticket you put it through a machine on the bus, it’s a little yellow box in the middle of the bus, the drivers not interested and we didn’t see any ticket inspectors, (right or wrong if you buy a 1 trip ticket and don’t validate it as we didn’t you could use the same one all week, (this is what we were told the locals all do!) The bus stop is out of the hotel and turn left, at the bottom of the road turn right and it’s 30ft down on the right, just down from there is a small supermarket where you can get milk etc, the rooms have a fridge so it will keep, its open until about 8pm I think. Being August most of the little shops in the area are shut but you can find the odd one open, we ate at a small pizza shop one evening and it was very nice, 2 drinks 2 large pieces of pizza and a Arancine Siciliane, (meat and rice thing a bit like a scotch egg without the egg) €10 the lot. Just walk past the bus stop to the bottom of the road, follow it round to the left and its 100 yards up on the left. There is no shopping centre as we know it in Rome, there is a large centre with over 200 shops outside Rome but you need the bus to get there, (well worth a visit) take the 990 from the hotel to the Vatican, cross the road and take the tube to the railway station, then get the 38 bus to the shopping centre, you can’t miss it when you get there, it’s called PORTA DI ROMA, when you leave the centre get the bus at the same place you got off as it does a full circle back to the train station, I would get a day bus ticket for €4 as it covers all bus and underground travel. It’s a lot easier than it sounds, trust me. There are several things to look out for when using the restaurants and shops, the closer you are to the Vatican the dearer they are, and they add a service charge, they added €5 to our €22 bill so be ware, a bottle of water costs €0:60 if you get it from the small supermarket at the Trevi Fountain to €2:50 by the Vatican, a standard can of coke is €1 - €4:00 depending on where you get it and half a larger was €6:00. Eating on the hoof is always cheaper and just as easy and will cost you a lot less. I could go on all day with this so if you have any questions please e-mail me: joe@jhoward7.wanadoo.co.uk and I will see what I can answer for you. I have attached some photo to this review, if you you want to see more please just ask.

Reviews.Title: “would go back in a heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: likes_her_comfort
Reviews.Content: Myself and my boyfriend stayed here for 3 days while we were in rome and it was amazing!! the service in the hotel was fantastic, the food amazing, the room was waaay bigger than expected, everything was clean and jus overall a great experience (make sure to check out the roof!! a bit grubby when we went but for the time of year i''d say its not used that much?) the location of the hotel was a bit of a downer though! :( there is a metro stop maybe ten minutes walk downhill but gettin home at night walkin uphill is a killer! there were times walkin back that i didnt feel safe in the surrounding area altho we never ran into any trouble! i would definitley return to the tiberio. good prices for a great stay!!

Reviews.Title: “COZY”
Reviews.Author: Tansz
Reviews.Content: My Mother, sister, and I spent 5 nights at the Grand Hotel Tiberio in mid-April this year. I can recommend this hotel. Here are the pro's and con's. Pro's: 1. Good free breakfast with yummy cappuccino from 7-10AM daily. 2. Large rooms with clean bathroom. 3. Friendly staff, most speak fluent english. 4. Good prices on food and drinks in the hotel. 5. Free shuttle service to the vatican and downtown with a cute driver :)! Con's 1. No alarm clock in room. Bring your own! 2. Pillow's are thin, ask for extra's. 3. Shuttle service is limited to a few times a day and fills up fast. 4. Only 1 english speaking channel, but hey it's Rome and who wants to watch TV all day? 5. Not close to any attractions, you will need a cab or use the shuttle. It is in a safe residential area. Although graffetti covers most of buildings. Most of Rome is like that. I am giving this hotel a solid 3 star rating by european standards. I booked through Travelocity and got a decent deal. Shopping tip for ladies--Go to the Spanish Steps. All the high end stores are in that area! I definately reccommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel but kind of far away”
Reviews.Author: bengalcatlover
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from our first trip to Italy. We visited Rome first and stayed at the Grand Hotel Tiberio. It was really a very nice hotel and we were very comfortable during our stay there. The room was quite large actually and a nice surprise as I have always heard that European hotels are so small. There were only 2 of us but the room could have easily held 4 people thanks to two fold out sofas. The bathroom was big and even had two sinks. The hairdryer was wimpy but I managed. The restaurant was really very good. We had dinner there are first night and I can't complain. The breakfast spread was absolutely wonderful. Meats, cheese, breads and a wide assortment of sweets (my favorite part). This hotel had a better breakfast than the other two we stayed at. There was even a nice outdoor patio to sit on. The staff was helpful and courteous. No problems there. My only dislike about this hotel was it's location. This was my first time in Rome but I felt that this hotel was kind of far away from the main center of town. It was fairly close to the Vatican but pretty far from everything else. The hotel does offer a nice shuttle to the Vatican and one other stop closer to town. We took advantage of this once. There was a bus stop nearby but you have to figure out the bus system which is a little confusing. The nearest metro station is about a 10 minute walk. It's very easy to use but does not get you to all places. We had to take taxi's a couple of times which were a little expensive. Overall this is a really wonderful hotel but if I ever went to Rome again I would look for a hotel that is closer to the action. I would say that this hotel is perfect for the business traveler though.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, but not a great location”
Reviews.Author: g12doc
Reviews.Content: Reception Staff All spoke very good English and were friendly and helpful even when our party of 12 descended upon them they were efficient and courteous. Rooms The room was very good, the bed comfortable even if the pillows were as thin as toast. Speaking of toast, it was like an inferno when I arrived, in keeping with the difference I have observed many times between Italians and people from the North of england. We hardy souls need a little frost on the inside of our windows to be able to sleep whereas Italians consider it impossibly cold if the outside temperature drops below 21C. The room was hot enough to coddle an egg and even the windows wide open were insufficient to cool it for me. Otherwise the room was clean, tidy, spacious and generally very good Food The evening meal was nothing short of wonderful. the breakfast standard Italian fare - which means the bare essentials and LOTS of cakes. Ok though, and had much worse elsewhere in Italy Location The hotel is not situated very conveniently for the tourist sites and you would really need a taxi to get to just about anywhere. Havin said that you muight want to put up with a bit of inconvenience for the sake of staying in a good little hotel. Still gets the thumbs up from me!

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hotel Tiberio, Rome”
Reviews.Author: samontherocks
Reviews.Content: I cannot recommend the Grand Hotel Tiberio in Rome enough. It was excellent value for money. The staff were friendly and the location was great. We were not right in the centre of the city, but close to the Sistine Chapel and on a lovely side of the river. I felt that for the money it was well worth a little walk to the main attractions. In fact, Rome is made for walking in. We were near a nature reserve so we got some green time in as well as Colosseum time. The amenities were fabulous - great bathroom, comfortable bed, good breakfast. Overall, while I was a bit worried about the location, in the end we made the right decision to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Tiberio, We Will Be Back.”
Reviews.Author: piecic
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay. The staff is very professional and willing to help you. Almost every one at the desk spoke English. There is a bus stop within 50 yards of the hotel. This bus takes you within a 5 minute walk to the Vatican. There is metro stop near the hotel, but the walk is about 20 minutes or more. We took the bus alot. The hotel itself is very chic, and modern. In order to have electricity in your room, you must insert your room key into the access panel of your room. Pretty cool stuff. The hotel staff set up my wife and I with a private car (Mercedes) and driver to bring us to the airport (50 euro, plus tip). The continental breakfast each morning was clutch. There are tours at the desk available. I recommend taking the Vatican musem/Sistine Chapel tour. You jump ahead of the two hour long lines and you get a decent tour guide with lots of info. All around great hotel. The view is not much to speak of, but the location, the price and the staff all are great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Not So Great Location”
Reviews.Author: AlwaysUp4Travel
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice, well-kept, clean, with average-sized European rooms. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The hotel provides a free shuttle to the Vatican and also makes a stop in the center of the city, which makes it easy to walk to various sites. The hotel location is ~15 minutes from the Vatican / St. Peter's Square, but there's not much else of significance in the area. The are LOTS of buildings with graffiti and the hotel sits in the middle of apartment complexes. There are a couple of small markets and a few restaurants within walking distance. The food at the hotel restaurant is pretty good, but I'd recommend trying other local restaurants throughout the city. The hotel itself is nice, but beacuse of its location, I'd recommend staying on the other side of the river near more tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean hotel, but many technical hitches!”
Reviews.Author: OnTheR0ad
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a residential location, close to a train and bus station. The exterior and interior is very clean and well presented, if not the most stylish of hotels. The staff were very helpful and friendly in all areas of the hotel. Check-in was quick and the staff also assisted us with travel options to the Rome tennis tournament. Breakfast is OK, a good selection, would have preferred more fresh fruit rather than the tinned pineapples, pears and peaches. There was a bowl of apples, but that was the only fresh fruit. Bedrooms are fine, not huge but plenty big enough. Double-glazed windows keep out any external noise and the curtains were good - kept the room very dark. We had a bath with shower, the shower was great but we ended up with water all over the floor. In terms of location, we walked rather than use the local transport. There are some very good nearby restaurants, which we used in the evening. In the day we walked to the Metro, except for the days we went to the tennis and the day we walked to the Vatican museum. The walk to Cipro Metro is approx. 20 mins and its uphill on the way home. On the downside, we had numerous problems with our room or should I say rooms, which is why I had to give the hotel the rating I did. Its a shame because this could be a great hotel. I would advise people to check that everything in the room is working before they unpack. In our first room, the lights didn't work so they fixed that immediately. Then we set off to go out and the door locking was broken, so we ended up moving room. In our new room, we later on discovered that the air-con was broken, which we weren't happy about, being British and not used to hot weather! The air-con never got fixed in the 3 nights we were there and it did really annoy us, we found it just too hot to sleep. Oh and the final problem was our safe ran out of batteries. To some extent, I do think we were just unlucky. We were part of a group of 6 and one couple had no problems while the other couple had no air-con either. So in our experience, 2 out of 3 rooms had no air-con, so if this is important to you, check it when you arrive.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Doppelgangers
Reviews.Content: We were a party of 10 couples who stayed at this hotel in February 2007. We liked the quietness of the hotel as Rome is such a manic city for traffic. The hotel seems out of the loop for Rome but we found it an excellent base. The hotel was lovely and clean, the staff were very nice, particularly the nice barman in the downstairs bar. The breakfast was excellent, and the rooms were very clean and nicely appointed. Myself and my fellow travellers would definitley book this hotel again and we would recommend it to other people.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pax-7
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel.....Front desk very accomodating with tourist sites. Wonderful walk to Vatican City and perfect bus ride on the 990 for those who do not wish to walk. Room (Double) was large and very clean. The Hotel Restaurant was Amazing, the food Excellent and very Delicious. The next time we are in Rome we will most certainly stay at the Grand Hotel Tiberio.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday”
Reviews.Author: droli
Reviews.Content: Our first 2 nights in Rome was at this hotel. It was a night mare to get to even in the day time because we happen to be at the time the metro accident occured. Struggled to get to hotel by bus, numerous changes...ended up taking a taxi 15 Euros from bus stop near Termini station. On first impressions this hotel is in a quiet residential district but very hilly roads and a little isolated. The rooms were decent with double glazing but the bathroom only had a small shower. The breakfast is good compare to the Grand Ritz, with scrambled eggs and bacon. Freshly made coffee / tea /chocolate. The location is not brilliant altought there is the train FR3 stop Appiano right behind the hotel. The trains are infrequent, and stop early at night 10pm max. On our first night we caught the MR2 bus (in place of the metro routes) to the train stop Valle Aurelia, but discovered the last train had departed 15mins ago. Thought we could walk it back to the hotel, but got terribly lost...ended up asking a local restaurant to call a taxi for us.... didn't get back till 11:30pm. Definitely not a good idea to stay here if you want late nights out. All in all I would give this hotel an upper 3 star if minus the breakfast + service. The hotel does provide a free shuttle 9-seater Merc Vito to the Vatican + Castle Santangelo a day. 2 in the mornings 9am + 10am and 6pm.

Reviews.Title: “Keep looking unless you like bus rides”
Reviews.Author: AAPW
Reviews.Content: This hotel is advertised as a 4 star - but that is probably a stretch. The good - staff is friendly and very helpful, the rooftop terrace is pleasant and the hotel area is quiet. Each room has a real balcony. However, although the rooms are fairly large, they are not particularly well appointed. No luggage racks, minimal lighting, foam mattresses, and our shelf in the bathroom was installed at a 10 degree slant so everything rolled off. The restaurant food was very unexceptional. The bus ride into the closest attraction is significant. The hotel does have a shuttle to the Vatican area, but it is very infrequent. Many of the people staying here appear to be on bus tours so the transportation issue is probably not an issue for most of the clientele. All in all I will stay somewhere else on my next trip to Rome so I can spend more time where I want to be rather than getting to where I want to be.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for the Vatican but not for the centre”
Reviews.Author: sandra_flitwick
Reviews.Content: This is a spotlessly clean hotel with very friendly and attentive staff. However, if you want somewhere convenient for the centre of Rome, then I'd look elsewhere. The hotel has a very contemporary style, which we loved. We wanted to be close to the Vatican (it was a 15 minute walk) and we wanted a quiet location away from the hussle and bussle. We also wanted good connections into the centre of Rome. The hotel perfectly matched our requirements. The beds were the most comfortable that I've ever had in a hotel, and I've done lots of travelling! However, the neighbouring area is spoilt by the amount of graffiti and posters on the walls. This is the case throughout Rome, and the authorities really need to tackle this, as it is very off-putting. Having said that, the area is very safe to walk around at night. If you decide to stay here, the local train station is a 2 minute walk around the corner, Trains go to Rome every 15 minutes and are very reliable. The station is called Via Appiano, which is one stop away from Valle Aurelia metro. There are lifts in both stations, which is handy for baggage. Breakfasts were very nice indeed, plenty of tea and coffee; scrambled aggs and bacon, selections of cereals and fruit, and a wonderful selection of pastries. The only let-down was the dinner. I had salmon in orange and mint sauce which I was really looking forward to, but it was too dry and a big disappointment. Hence, we dined elsewhere for the rest of the holiday. A nearby restaurant that we highly recommend is the Isola Della Pizza in Via Scriponi. You don't need to reserve , but it is very popular, so you may have to wait for a table. Hope this review is helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Do not trust this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kapf1
Reviews.Content: I would think twice about making a reservation at this hotel. We arrived with a reservation, which they acknowledged, but said they had no rooms available. Their solution was very shady as they offered to pay for us to stay at a hotel that was nowhere near the same quality or price, thereby profiting from the deal. They also said we had to pay if we wanted to use the internet to check out the new hotel before we left. If you chose this hotel, I would confirm & reconfirm the reservation before arriving.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with the location”
Reviews.Author: DanielleNotts
Reviews.Content: Just spent a week at the Tiberio and mainly based on the reviews I saw on Trip Advisor. I was seduced by the nice breakfast and good rooms (and the price). To be honest I would not stay here again. The rooms were fine (although our electricty kept breaking and we were unable to get the lights on) the breakfast was very average - I was expecting far more after reading these reviews, it was well presented and ok if you like eating cakes and sweet pastries but that aside nothing to write home about (great coffee). Location was poor, too far out, there was a train station right next door but by the time the train came in (every half and hour) it was easier to walk down to the Vatican and get the metro from there. This was pretty fast (and took about 10-15 minutes to walk down there). The Bus was very regular, really good but if I went to Rome again I would stay in the centre, Near the Collossium or Piazza di Spagna (Spanish Steps). The hotel had lots of tour groups staying there as well as Business people. If you were only staying for a night or two it is worth it...but if you are there longer and want to go sightseeing in the day and then nip back to get a shower and change before going out in the evening it is just too far...takes hours to get all the way back and then out again.!! The food places around the hotel were not much cop...they shut very early...even turned off the music to get us to leave quicker. The hotel do not serve food after 10pm as well.....! The centre of Rome is still alive and kicking at this time. Overall its a nice hotel, decent rooms, very good service, but too far out! Better suited to retired groups that are happy to get a coach tour in the day and stay in for some keyboard music, early meal and then to bed. Which is what it tended to be there.

Reviews.Title: “would not recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is 20 minutes walk to Vatican not 10 minutes (unless you run) and the walk is not a very pleasant one, especially if you are returning to the hotel past 7pm. the walkways are extremely dirty (worse than the center of the city) and there is nothing scenic about it. It was just too far from all attractions. Our room was a good size room but the carpet had seen much better days (badly stained). You sure do not want to walk bare footed. The bathroom smelled like urine and all faucets had lime deposit and mildew on them. Breakfast was just OK. Staffs were friendly and helpful. I would not recommend this hotel at all. In a big city, you either look for the location or the amenity of a hotel and this hotel had neither one. this hotel barely passes a 3 stars standards.

Reviews.Title: “No customer service”
Reviews.Author: MamaRugg
Reviews.Content: 37 of us stayed in this hotel in December. We arrived at 1am, the bar was closed and room service was finished. The staff were offhand and unhelpful. There was a sign in the lift to say there would be no water the following day! They said there was nothing they could do. The breakfast was appalling and we were told off for moving a jug of milk from the buffet table to our table! The location is not good either!! Not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Tiberio - Not bad at all!”
Reviews.Author: SNJF
Reviews.Content: Myself and two friends stayed here for 3 nights in April 2005. We had a triple room, so were expecting to be put in the boiler room, but were pleasantly surprised. Slightly cramped but perfectly clean and comfortable. The staff were great and even the cleaning lady was happy to help with my pigeon Italian request for an iron! It is a little out of the city centre but we got a real bargain on lastminute which made it worthwhile, and once you get used to the public transport this is not an issue. On a sunny day the Vatican is within walking distance. My only warning would be to keep an eye on the mini bar and bar tab!

Reviews.Title: “Pleased”
Reviews.Author: blondino
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our three night stay from Tiberio. The hotel is wonderful. The equipments and accessories are fantastic which means to me that the managers pay attention to details. Except, the balcony could have been cleaner. But that is everything I can say negatively. In the meantime, the hotel is really in a walking distance (10 mins) from Cipro station (Metro A) that took us to Termini in an other 10 mins. I don't think at all that that's a long way or should be mentioned as a horrific problem as I read in some reviews before. Altough the public transport is really hectic. I have a suspicion that the bus drivers in Rome don't have a schedule they just come whenever they fancy. So, discover the city on foot! And I really suggest Grand Hotel Tiberio as a starting point.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Tiberio OK”
Reviews.Author: onanisle
Reviews.Content: We also stayed at the Hotel Grand Tiberio. As the previous writer noted, it is difficult to find and a long way from the train station. I was struck by the high cost of such things as soft drinks. But, the Euro may be the cause of this. The dollar isn't worth as much as it use to be. The rooms in the hotel are very nice, modern and comfortable. You can walk a way down the road and find restaurants everywhere. We stopped in one. The waiter was very rude and said they were closing at 3pm in the afternoon. He lied. It doesn't close. I suspect being an American had something to do with his attitude. Rome's sights are incredible. We took a tour bus and hit the highlights as our time was short. The Vatican is amazing. Bob Miller

Reviews.Title: “So So”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This highlight of this hotel is that it is beautifully decorated - very contemporary. However, the hotel is tricky to find and they do not let you park on their grounds although they have plenty of room outside. When we arrived we were informed that parking is 15 euros per night, which is managed by an outside concession. When we complained that this had not been mentioned, they claimed it's on their website......but try finding it. We had prepaid so Manager was amiable but did not budge. And yes they do have a broadband internet connection but it's 22 euros per day. That isn't mentioned on the website either. Breakfast is included and fairly good. Too many other nice hotels in Rome to do this one again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Expirence”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel,clean, modern with helpful staff. Decent breakfast location not to bed , about 20-30min walk to Vatican with bus stop and metro just outside hotel, quick ride to tourist area. Totaly satisfide

Reviews.Title: “Great!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 5 nights in April 2005.I booked it through internet in a very affordable price (105 euros per night).It is a very good hotel,well-equiped, clean and with great service. The breakfast was excellent!!! You should try the little bisquits!The only problem was that it was a little bit far from the city center, but the bus routes were frequent and very helpful.I strongly reccomend it.

Reviews.Title: “Warning 3 - hotel systematically overbooks”
Reviews.Author: uZurich
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hotel Tiberio over the internet 1 month ahead (hotels) and everything was confirmed for our stay in mid-May 2005. However, on the arrival date (late evening and very tired) we were told that unfortuanetly the hotel was overbooked !! We were very disappointed. The manager on duty at that time who told us this was "Alessandro". He told us that he will offer us a similar hotel with the same rating, however this hotel was not at all comparable. We suspect that this hotel systematically overbooks and especially turns down at last minute people who book over the intrant at very affordable prices. The prefer higher paying customers und "outsource" people who book over the intranet to another hotel in times when the hotel is fully booked. Very bad. Gambling attitutude of the Grandhotel Tiberio !! U. Bossart

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked three rooms for five nights at the Grand Hotel Tiberio in October 2004 for a March 2005 vacation. When I arrived at the hotel, I was told the hotel only recieved my reservation that morning (not true) and they were fully booked. They reserved us rooms at a hotel 20 minutes further away! When I refused those rooms they told me there was nothing they could do to help - all of the hotels in Rome were booked. (not true) and if I could find a room they would arrange for billing through them. I called my travel agent in NY and she promptly found us 3 great rooms at the Nuovo Hotel Quattro Fontane. Grand Hotel Tiberio then refused arrange for billing and it took me several weeks and several letters to get a credit! Definitely NOT a Grand experience.

Reviews.Title: “Warning!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Rome. We booked a double room in December 2004 for March 2005 in Grand Hotel Tiberio. As usual we got a confirmation of our booking. However I called Tiberio one month before and they said everything was fine with the booking. As I read some bad reviews about overbooking I sent an e-mail to the hotel 4 days before our trip to double-check and in one day I got a written confirmation from the general manager of the hotel that they couldn't wait to welcome us and of course, everything is OK with our booking. These two positive feedbacks really reassured us so we got excited as this trip was part of our honeymoon (I noted that on our booking sheet too). When we arrived to the hotel and handed over the voucher to the front office manager she disappeared and came back in a minute with a troubled face. She asked us to sit down and started to explain that they had problems with the booking system and they didn't have any room for us but there is another four-star hotel where we can sleep (a four-star same class hotel). When I showed the written confirmation of the general manager she said that she couldn't do anything about that. We were pretty tired and as we had only 3 nights in Rome we wanted to park with the luggages and started to discover the city we said ok as we felt really defenseless. They called a cab and took us to the other hotel. You may check this hotel (San Giorgio) on Tripadvisor too. The room and the lobby smelt and was very used. The equipments and the bed was probably from the ancient Rome. It wasn't ideal for honeymoon at all. I definetely wouldn't pay the same price for one night in San Giorgio that for Grand Tiberio. We were deceived THREE times by Grand Hotel Tiberio. Firstly, over the phone one month before the trip, secondly by the general manager 4 days before the trip and thirdly, when they informed us that the hotel we might sleep at instead is the same quality. If you want to have a peaceful and relaxed holiday in Rome, choose an other hotel. I wouldn't suggest this one as you may suddenly feel as a second-class customer - like we were treated by them.

HotelInfo.Name: Grand Hotel Tiberio
HotelInfo.Address: Via Lattanzio 51, 00136 Rome, Italy
